lines.text: I didn't know you had a father. I thought we are all orphans.
My mother was Korean, and my father was Black American. She gave me this picture when she was real sick. I was only nine years old.

[Dragon Sound gets jumped by a bunch of thugs]
This doesn't look like the welcome wagon.

[Tom is at the beach checking out all the women]
They don't make buns like that down at the bakery.
Listen to me. I don't want to have any trouble. I just get the job from agent. Don't bother us.
So, Mark, how do you feel about putting some board breaking into the act?
We could write another taekwondo song, and after Tom does one of his guitar solos, we could all break boards. Jack could do a drum solo. How 'bout it, Jack?
Love to help you write that song, John, but there's no way I'm gonna break any boards in that club. I don't even want us to play there anymore.
Why? 'Cause that other band jumped us the other night?
Yeah... because of Jeff, too. He's in there every night with his damn... gang, selling that stupid cocaine.
